title: make check should suspend TIME_PASSES env var for pretty tests?
body:
It appears to me that running `make check` while there's an env var `TIME_PASSES` set to 1 causes all pretty-print tests to fail, because (it appears to me) the makefile passes `-Z time-passes` to the invocation of `rustc --pretty normal`, causing (e.g.) this failure:

``` rust

    task '[pretty] run-pass/writealias.rs' failed at 'explicit failure', /Users/clements/rust/src/compiletest/runtest.rs:1311


---- [pretty] run-pass/x86stdcall.rs stdout ----

    error: pretty-printing failed in round 1
    status: exit code: 101
    command: x86_64-apple-darwin/stage2/bin/rustc - --pretty normal --target=x86_64-apple-darwin -L x86_64-apple-darwin/test/run-pass/x86stdcall.stage2-x86_64-apple-darwin.libaux --cfg rtopt --cfg debug -Z time-passes -O -L x86_64-apple-darwin/rt
    stdout:
    ------------------------------------------

    ------------------------------------------
    stderr:
    ------------------------------------------
    <anon>:1:1: 1:5 error: expected item but found `time`
    <anon>:1 time: 0.001 s  parsing
             ^~~~

    ------------------------------------------
```

... note that the parser is failing in trying to parse the line `time: 0.001 s  parsing`.. 

looks like an easy fix in a makefile, if it's even worth fixing. Depends on how other folks feel about it.
